titleStmt.title: Tamiḻneṟi Viḷakkam 18.
Experimenting with formatting for the final edition.

div.p: The speech where [the heroine] excessively divugles her love [to her confidante]; the speech of her confidante while [the hero] has gone outside the wall [of the house]In this situation, the heroine's friend speaks to herself while he is within earshot, though not visible, and so, in practice, speaks to him.; [her confidante] informing [the hero] of her confinement; [her confidante] thinking "[The hero has made] a vow."; [her confidante] speaking about [the heroine's] death; [the hero] saying "It is necessary to come at night."; [the confidante] rejecting [that idea]; [the confidante] agreeing [to the idea]; [the confdiante] designating the meeting-place; [the confidante?] speaking so [the heroine?] agrees [to the tryst]; [the confidante] informing [the heroine] that he is coming; [the confidante] leading her to the designated place; [the confidante] speaking while [the hero] is outside the surrounding wall about the false sign and [the hero] leaving; and [the hero] suffering - [these are the situations of] the nighttime tryst which is occurs outside of the house.
The quoted [cūttiram] intends to make known the way in which the nighttime tryst occurs.
vāy viṭu kiḷavi mutal ākat talaimakaṉeñcoṭu nōtal īṟākac collap paṭṭaṉa vil varai ikavā viravuk kuṟi yām eṉṟa vāṟu.
The things mentioned, beginning with 'the speech [where she] divulges' and ending with 'the hero aching with his heart', are the nighttime tryst that occurs outside the boundary of the house.
eṉpatu talaimakaḷ āṟṟāmaik kaṇ vāy viṭu kiḷavi.
The speech where the heroine divulges her inability to bear [her current situationship].
eṉpatu talaimakaṉ ciṟaip puṟam ākap piṟitiṉ mēl vaittut tōḻi kūṟiyatu.
The confidante speaks [about the heroine's suffering], blaming it on something else, while the hero is behind a wall.
[The confidante] indirectly informs [the hero] about [the heroine's] confinement.
[The confidante] informs [the hero] about [the heroine's] confinement while he is behind the wall.
[The confidante] clearly informs [the hero] about [the heroine's] confinement.
eṉpatu talaimakaṉ varavuṇarntu tōḻi talaimakaḷaik kuṟi vayiṉ uyttatu.
eṉpatu alla kuṟip paṭutal ciṟaip puṟam ākac colliṟṟu.

lg.l: peritu mevvam peṟaṟpā lōyēThis poem is not originally in the KKms. It is written in later, hence why I only report readings from KKpc.

standOff.note: Cf. TP131i: alllkuṟip paṭutalu mavaḷvayi ṉurittē | yavaṉkuṟi mayaṅkiya vamaivoṭu variṉē
Cf. IA17: allakuṟip paṭutalu mavviya ṉurittē | yavaṉvara vaṟiyuṅ kuṟippiṉāṉa
Cf. TP129i: iravu kuṟiyē yillakat tuḷḷu | maṉaiyōr kiḷavi kēṭkumvaḻi yatuvē | maṉaiyakam pukāak kālai yāṉa
Cf. IA19: iravuk kuṟiyē yilvarai yikavātu
TP128i and IA18 which were provided as sources for the previous cūttiram should be considered as a source for this one as well. They state that a tryst can occur both in the daytime and nighttime.
Cf. IAC18, p.106: uṭaṉāyirunta puḷḷunōkki ivaikaṇṭum āṟṟic colcāṭku, ivaiyum nīṅkiṉa, iṉi eṅṅaṉam aṟṟuṅkollō eṉat talaimakaṟkuc ciṟaippuṟaṉākac collum;
Cf. IAC18, p.107: kuṟippiṉāṉ varaivukaṭāvumāṟuː 'yāy emmai uṟuppiṟ kuṟikkoṇṭu nōkkiṉāḷ' eṉṉum;

Cf. PK145 (IAC18, p.106): perumā maṇimuṭi maṉṉaraip pūlantaip pūvaḻitta | kurumā maṇivaṇṇaṉ kōṉeṭu māṟaṉ kumarimunnīr | arumā maṇitikaḻ kāṉalaliṉ vāyvan takaṉṟakoṇkaṉ | tirumā maṇineṭun tēroṭuñ ceṉṟateṉ cintaṉaiyē||
Cf. IAC18, p.106: āṟṟaḷāy, neñcu mikkatu vāycōrntu, kaṭaliṟkāṉuṅ, kāṉaliṟ aḻutāṟpōlɒ oru coṟ collum;

Cf. PK146 (IAC18, p.106): aṉṉam puraiyum pulampeyta attameṉṉum | poṉṉañ cilampu katirōṉ maṟaitalum pōyiṉavāy | teṉṉeṉ tirumāl kaḻalneṭu māṟaṉ tiruntuceṅkōl | maṉṉaṉ kumarik karuṅkaḻi mēyntavaṇ ṭāṉaṅkaḷē||

Cf. PK147 (IAC18, p.106): peruṅkaḻal māṟaṉpul lāmaṉṉar pūlantaip pūṅkuruti | maruṅkaḻi nīrmūḻkak kaṇṭaeṅ kōṉtoṇṭik kāṉalvaṇṭār | karuṅkaḻi mēyntaceṅ kālveḷḷai aṉṉaṅ katiroṭuntam | peruṅkaḻi kātaṉmai nīṅki ivaḷiṟ pirintaṉavē||

Cf. PK148 (IAC18, p.107): mēyiṉa tampaṭai yōṭumem melliya lāḷaiventīp | pāyiṉa mālaikkuk kāṭṭik koṭuttup parantumaṇmēl | āyiṉa cīrāri kēcarik kaṉṟaḷa nāṭṭuṭaintu | pōyiṉa tevvariṟ pōyiṉa kāṉaliṟ puḷḷiṉamē||
The TNVC poem is clearly following the blueprint provided by the three PK poems cited in the IAC so they are all provided here.
Cf. PK150.3-4 (IAC18, p.108):...ākattu vantarumpum | iḷamulai nōkkīniṉ ṉeṉṉaiyum nōkkīṉaḷ emmaṉayē||
Cf. PK151.1 (IAC18, p.108): ceyalmaṉṉu māvatu collāy cilampa
